availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen B. Curran (Harrison County, KY, merchant)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Alletha Osken Curran in Bracken County, Kentucky, on April 24, 1826. Father of Thomas Curran, Mary Curran, William Curran, Rebecca Curran, James Curran, and Julia Curran. Merchant in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Harrison County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 98B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 659.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 127B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bracken County Marriages, Film 000344098, p. 28.
